Dear Customer Service,

We have an issue with the pipelines so the command that worked until this morning, now is not working.

Here are the error messages:\\
2018-05-04 13:07:32,067 [ERROR]: error executing command: docker run --mount type=bind,source=$(pwd)/artifacts/jobalert-controls,target=/tmp/artifacts/jobalert-controls -t lensa/jobalert-controls:bv54 /bin/sh -c "mkdir -p /tmp/artifacts/jobalert-controls/test-reports && ./test_node.sh"\\

2018-05-04 13:07:32,067 [ERROR]: See 'docker run --help'.

Could you help with this issue please?
fields.summary: Pipeline docker run "Command not supported"

fields.description:
In the previous Bitbucket/Slack integration, it was to manually create a webhook for each repository. This could be done via API to be applied to all repositories.

In the new integration, the webhooks are added to all repositories in the account as soon as the "Chat Notifications" is clicked on any one of the repositories. However, we will still need to manually click "Connect to Slack" to integrate. Once the account is integrated, we would need to manually access each repository in the account to add subscription.

It would be nice if we could integrate Bitbucket with Slack and subscribe to notifications for multiple repositories within an account.
fields.summary: Ability to Integrate Slack/Bitbucket to multiple repositories in an account via API

fields.description:
I am unable to modify branch permissions.\\
I am trying to add more people in the Write Access and Merge Via Pull Request.

Even if I try to edit and save without doing any modification, I am not able to do so.

I am always getting "An unexpected error occurred".
fields.summary: Unable to update Branch Permissions

fields.description:
Since Monday, I've been unable to access bitbucket pipelines, I have two accounts (A company account and a personal account). I'm experiencing the same issue on both of them.

When I click on pipelines. all I see is a blank page.

When I viewed the console, this is the error message I can see. I believe this prevents any content from showing up.

The weird thing, is that my other teammates don't have this Issue, they can access pipelines normally. I'm the only one experiencing this.

Another weird thing is that It works on another laptop. I signed in to a windows laptop earlier in the day and I didn't get this error.

My current computer is a Linux machine

I've attached an Image to show the blank page and the error in the console (I can reveal more details about the project if needed)
fields.summary: Unable to access Bitbucket pipelines

fields.description: The old Bitbucket app for Slack, which was maintained by Slack, and which is going to be shut down in a couple of months now that Atlassian has released an official integration, includes full commit messages -- not just the top line/subject. My team valued being able to write detailed messages, which would show up on Slack, and we'd really appreciate being able to retain this feature. I would think this would be trivial to do, at least as an option.
fields.summary: Include full commit messages in the new Bitbucket for Slack app

creating repo does not finish after progress bar\\
cannot delete or recreate this repo

fields.description: It would be great to have an option to mark an individual file as approved (maybe not visible to the PR author).  Also if we can collapse such files which have been approved, and not been changed in any subsequent commits, it would help to efficiently review large pull requests that have a lot of files.
fields.summary: Ability to approve individual files from a large Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While making a new commit with read-only access, Bitbucket Cloud unable to create PR after the repository is forked and a new commit is created automatically.

Browser's development tool is showing "Branch not found" error with the following request header:

{code}
#!python

Request URL: https://bitbucket.org/!api/internal/repositories/<Owner>/<Source_Repo_Name>/branches/<username>%2F12313-edited-online-with-bitbucket-1525328545588
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 404 Not Found
Remote Address: 104.192.143.3:443
Referrer Policy: no-referrer-when-downgrade
{code}

###Steps to Reproduce

# Ensure the account has *Read-only* access to the repository
# With BB UI, navigate to a file then click *Edit* button
# Modify the file then commit the changes

###Steps to Reproduce\\
Navigate to the forked repository then create a pull request to merge the changes to the destination repo.
fields.summary: Unable to auto create Pull-request

fields.description:
When pipelines build minutes has exceeded its allocated amount, 1000 minutes will be added in automatically for further use. The notification for this keeps showing up on every page in the repository.

Once the notification is closed, it does not show up on this specific tab. However, when you open the repository on a new tab, the notification shows up again.

!2892495945-1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Additional build minutes notification keeps showing on each page

fields.description:
This is a feature request to get Bitbucket Cloud to have an ability to search for a specific git commit number.

We use Bitbucket to store Terraform ( IAC software ) configuration. Our developers want an ability to roll back to a specific terraform configuration and to do that, git commit number would be an ideal solution.

However currently Bitbucket does not have an easy way to search for a specific git commit number. Please include this so it is easy to identify / go back to that specific state.
fields.summary: Search for a specific git commit number in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview is now capped at 50 PRs, which did not use to be the case. I have a large team with lots of PRs and the paged view because things are easily missed as you open the first page, work through the PRs, and when you move to the next page the ordering is different, PRs move around the list and its very easy for things to slip through the cracks, I want to be able to see all my PRs on a single page ordered by last updated so I can easily see everything currently being updated as well as be able to see the older stuff that has not been updated recently.
fields.summary: Be able to load more PR's on the overview page again

Our pipelines just started failing - we haven't changed anything in our pipeline configuration - here is the url:

* GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 git clone --branch="develop" --depth 50 https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/ordinaryexperts/complete-recycling.git $BUILD_DIR ; git reset --hard eda9ff2e660bc5ae3ada67782782aec72563a12d ; git remote set-url origin git@bitbucket.org:ordinaryexperts/complete-recycling.git\\
Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'...\\
fatal: repository 'https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/ordinaryexperts/complete-recycling.git/' not found

fields.description:
It seems that one of the most useful features for code review in BitBucket - the quick file search (shorcut key: "F" while in source).

https://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/02/07/introducing-quick-file-search/

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I would like to ask for a feature request. When a user is creating a repository, he/she is not able to choose, which groups have access to it:

!1241788575-repo1.png|thumbnail!

Once the repository is created, all the groups are added from the team account:

!1472230955-repo2.png|thumbnail!

I would like to ask, if you could do a feature/option, where the user could choose it BEFORE the repository is created, which groups from the team can have access to it.

Thank you for your help,\\
Norbert
fields.summary: Ability to grant repository access during the creation flow

fields.description:
Currently via this API call [List information of a commit|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/commits/%257Brevision%257D] which shows commit information including the Author.

An authenticated user could be pushing multiple commits to the remote repository. Therefore, it would be nice if the authenticated user who pushed the commits could be visible and included in the API Request as well.
fields.summary: Ability to view authenticated user who pushed commits

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Rerun previous build after renaming repository will receive the following error during the "Build setup" step.

{code}
#!python

+ GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 git clone --branch="master" --depth 50 https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/USER/New_Name.git $BUILD_DIR ; git reset --hard <commit-hash> ; git remote set-url origin git@bitbucket.org:USER/New_Name.git
Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'...
remote: Repository USER/Old_Name not found
fatal: repository 'https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/USER/Old_Name.git/' not found
{code}

###Steps to Reproduce

# Rename repository with previous builds triggered

#* *Repository Settings>Repostiory Details>Update _Name_ >Save repository details*
# Navigate to *Pipelines* page
# Rerun previous build then check _Build Setup_ step

###Expected Results\\
The new rerun build should clone using the new repository name during _Build Setup_ step

###Current Outcome\\
The new rerun build will clone using the old repository name during _Build Setup_ step
fields.summary: Unable rerun build which triggered before repo renamed

fields.description:

"New source browser experience"  in the Labs, the error comes up with\\

Workaround until this is resolved is to go to:\\
Avatar -> Bitbucket Labs  -> Turn Off "New source browser experience"
fields.summary: With new SourceView in Bitbucket the Sonar AddOn returns an error

fields.description:
So for context - we have a custom master branch pipeline that occurs each time that a pull request is merged into our master branch. In this build, once all the tests pass and all the other checks are successful we tag the commit with a version number - this certifies to our team that this commit is good to proceed to the next stage in our deployment. This provides us with certainty that each and every change we make is stable, but as you might have guessed this means that we can only process one pull request at a time.

If we merge more than one PR into master then our tagging system risks getting confused - which creates work for our team to clean up. Is there a way to allow builds using a custom pipeline to queue up rather than all running at once? Or should we rethink our entire tagging system?
fields.summary: Allow Custom Pipeline builds to be queued

fields.description:
I can't find this if it exists already, but I'd like to be able to specify which of my many emails is the default on a per project basis. For example, I use my work email on some projects, but when PRs are merged, the author of the merge becomes my account default email even though all the commits in the merge are my work email.

If this is possible, that would be great. thanks!
fields.summary: Allow setting email per project

fields.description:
With the feature "New Source Browser experience" enabled, Bitbucket Notebook Viewer is not able to render correctly. It gives an error "Unable to render notebook" and there is an Internal Server Error on the console. Screenshot as below.

*Workaround*

* Click Avatar at bottom left corner of the Bitbucket Page
* Click "Bitbucket Labs"
* On the feature "New Source Browser experience", click the slider to disable it
* Notebook Viewer should be able to render properly.

!3391518246-1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket Notebook Viewer unable to render with New Source Browser feature enabled

I think the header is wrong and the correct title should be "Watching"

was wondering if I can also query api for all open pull requests in my organization/team and/or by user?

basically  what you see on the pull request overview on the bitbucket homepage

please also see: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-77584

tx

fields.description:
How to reproduce, create a repo, add README.md with the following content:

{code}
[Test](#test)

(add many lines here to hide the section)

## Test
{code}

Then visit: https://bitbucket.org/<company>/<repo>/src/master/ and click on the first link from README.md. This happens due to two problems at once:

# You have an ugly file scroll inside a div instead of a normal page scroll (really hate it, and I would hack it in my browser, but you seem to have dynamic class names)
# You add a prefix to an anchor id, i.e instead of {{compilation}} you have {{markdown-header-compilation}}.

This feature works everywhere (e.g. on github), but not on bitbucket.
fields.summary: README.md internal anchors do not jump to the corresponding section

fields.description:
When I create a pull request the "to" branch is always set to "master". Most of the time this is what I want, but sometimes I've created a feature branch from a release branch. In this case I want to merge back into this branch, not into master.

I often forget to change the "to" branch (since 95% of the time it's correct) and merge the PR into the wrong branch. This wastes quite a bit of time as I cannot just merge master into the release branch - I have to basically re-do the PR.

Please make the "to" branch default smarter - set it to the parent branch of the "from" branch [see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3161204/find-the-parent-branch-of-a-git-branch]. If the parent branch cannot be detected then leave the "to" branch blank so that the user must set it manually.
fields.summary: Default pull request "merge to" branch to parent branch of "from" branch

On laptop A, I make some changes commit them then I push them to the origin using 'git push -u origin new-branch'. I can see them under commits on bitbucket.org.

Then when I go to Laptop B and run 'git fetch' says up to date. run 'git pull'. Says already up to date. I cannot pull down the latest commits from the branch.

Go back to bitbucket.org and the commits are still listed there. If I create a new branch then go and fetch it on Laptop B. If I  run 'git pull' on that old branch it will now return the commits I was missing.

Is there an issue with Bitbucket Cloud is not pushing down new commits unless new branch is created.

fields.description:
The names of files in the source browser as well as the names of downloaded files are displayed incorrectly (probably because they something other than the UTF-8 encoding). Not a big issue knowing that the use of non-Latin characters in file names is a bad practice but still it would be nice to see this fixed.

!1483971282-bbbug.png|thumbnail!

!1402780651-DeepinScreenshot_select-area_20180425215905.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issues with cyrillic file names (downloads and source browser titles)

fields.description:
According to the Bitbucket cloud docs, some API rate limiting is enforced:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/rate-limits-668173227.html

However there is no way (and I've confirmed with Atlassian support) for us to view the status of the current API request counts in the BB UI to be able to tell if we are going over the limits.

It would be nice if the Bitbucket UI had an "Admin" page somewhere to allow viewing a summary (at least counts and perhaps maybe the timestamp of the most recent API request) of API requests made against our Bitbucket account.

(Bonus: If we go over the limit, it would be nice if repo admins could get an email notification telling us of this)
fields.summary: Add summary info for current API request counts to UI

fields.description:
Try to connect to Trello from the webinterface under "Boards". Both options "Create a new board" and "Select an existing board" bringing me to a new explorer window with an error: This request came from an unauthorized domain.

It doesn't matter which browser, connection, OS or if I'm loggend in within trello.
fields.summary: Unauthorized trello connection

fields.description:
When using the dropdown in the top right of the dashboard/overview page, to switch sort order, the dashboard breaks.

It now shows some welcome screen, and there is no way to revert this. Happened to a colleague of mine too.
fields.summary: When dashboard/overview repos, breaks the dashboard

fields.description:
Hi. Unfortunately, for many months bitbucket.org does not work correctly on all providers of Kazakhstan. But if several months ago only one of three IP-addresses of the domain was blocked (104.192.143.2), then approximately two weeks our providers blocked access to all IP-addresses of the domain (104.192.143.1, 104.192.143.2, 104.192.143.3).\\
Here is the official response of the Ministry of Information of Kazakhstan: https://dialog.egov.kz/blogs/all-questions/493169 , https://dialog.egov.kz/blogs/all-questions/493062 , https://dialog.egov.kz/questioncontroller/view?id=491464 (use Google Translate).\\
In short - our Ministry found on the bitbucket.org signs of propaganda of narcotic drugs (yes, that's funny). And they are trying to find contacts with the administration of the website (maybe even a legal address to send a letter by post, we can expect anything). Maybe someone of the support team can write them a message and ask what they want to delete? Their contacts are here: http://mic.gov.kz/en/kategorii/kontakty-18
fields.summary: bitbucket.org is blocked in Kazakhstan

fields.description:
It would be great if you could add {{SSHFP}} records to your DNS. In these days, it's pretty normal to use {{VerifyHostKeyDNS yes}} in SSH client, so no more manual confirmations of host key fingerprint is necessary.

{code}
The authenticity of host 'bitbucket.org (104.192.143.1)' can't be established.
RSA key fingerprint is 97:8c:1b:f2:6f:14:6b:5c:3b:ec:aa:46:46:74:7c:40.
No matching host key fingerprint found in DNS.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)?
{code}
fields.summary: Add SSHFP records to DNS

fields.description:
Dear team,

Kindly help me please to solving this issue. Every time I try to use webhook I always get "Request status: NET_ERR". It is your bug? or maybe I just need some config? I am looking for the solution in Google but someone told me to report to Bitbucket team.

Thanks
fields.summary: #Request status: NET_ERR

fields.description:
Upon creating more than 10 App Passwords on Bitbucket UI, the oldest App Password will not be visible in the UI. The UI only displays the last 10 app passwords.

However, the App Password can still be used even though it's not visible on the UI and the app password isn't revoked.

To revoke that the old password, you will have to revoke the latest app password for the older app password to be visible in the UI.
fields.summary: App Passwords only list the last 10 in Bitbucket UI and older app password are hidden.

fields.description:
We have noticed that some of the push commits were missed from the repositories Recent Activity feed. This is mostly happening during periods of heavy activity on Bitbucket.\\
Our team is working on a resolution
fields.summary: Push commits are missing from repository Recent Activity Feed (BBSRE-2438)

fields.description:
(1) This page: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/search?q=authentication

Gives no results for "authentication"

I expected it to find at least this page:\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/meta/authentication

(2) Additionally, your API Reference pages, such as this one (below), do not have any mention of authentication. The Bitbucket API is unusable without it.

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/src/%7Bnode%7D/%7Bpath%7D
fields.summary: cannot look up API documentation for "authentication"

fields.description:
All pipelines for our company https://bitbucket.org/egym-com/ are not reachable, e.g., https://bitbucket.org/egym-com/user-profile-data-service/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/4

It seams that the domain https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/ is not reachable by DNS.

This is a huge blocker for us.
fields.summary: Bitbucket pipelines is not reachable

fields.description:
Dear Team,

Please add the advanced search criteria on: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/issues.

Also please show in the listing the name of the user that has the issue assigned.

In this moment from the dashboard you can't see all issues allocated for an user. This is not very user friendly.
fields.summary: advanced filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue tracker search function does not give any results for search words containing the underscore ( _ ) character. This happens if underscore ( _ ) character is in issue Title, Description or comments.

h3. Expected Results

The search should return result matching the search criteria

h3. Actual Results

There is no search result and number of identified issues will show as (1-1 of 1)

h3. Workaround

Use Advanced search for search in issue Title and Description
Currently no workaround available for search in issue Comment. Workaround for search in comment will be mentioned here once available.

 
!374509440-1.PNG|thumbnail!

!3777267837-2.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Search function for issues with underscore character title does not return correct result.

fields.description:
Pipelines should throw some handled error messages for simple requests such as failed to push due to Branch permissions or failed to clone due to no access to the repo (mainly error messages that relate to BItbucket in some sort of way).

Such error messages should be something like "Failed to push changes due to no branch permissions" or "You don't have access to the remote repository you are trying to clone".

These errors should be thrown on build time when a build has failed because of such errors. Today it seems that the error messages are somewhat unclear.
fields.summary: Better error messages for Pipelines.

fields.description:
Changing the target branch on a Pull Request generate null commits when making an API PR endpoint call

https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/<owner>/<repository>/pullrequests/number/activity

This is caused by commits that became unreachable due to "rebase" away.

If you have an active Pull Request and use rebase away on one of the branches - this might come up so, avoid this may help.
fields.summary: API returning invalid pull request activity update item in payload(BBS-75893)

fields.description:
I can't seem start pipelines from a feature branch.\\
I started the pipeline by going to the branches view and choosing {{run pipeline for a branch}}. Whenever I try to run pipelines this way, the build doesn't start. It hangs on this screen:

!3386579153-pipeline_not_running_on_branch_cropped.png|thumbnail!

I'm on the bitbucket_pipelines branch. My bitbucket-pipelines.yml looks like this:

{code}
#!yml

pipelines:
  branches:
    '{master, develop, bitbucket_pipelines}':
      - step:
          name: Build
          caches:
            - bundler
          script: 
            - ruby script/setup_pipeline_configs.rb
            - bundle install
            - bundle exec rspec
{code}
fields.summary: Manually running pipeline freezes when multiple branches are used for same pipeline

fields.description: It's super-nice of you that you have some fancy fan-out menus to help new people started on how to setup and add remotes to either new or existing git projects, but a simple field showing {{show git@bitbucket.org:xxx/xxx.git}} in the top somewhere would be more than enough for people like me that use other patterns than origin (and have most git command in their fingers like muscle memory) and people using custom tools like GUI's / IDE's
fields.summary: show git@bitbucket.org:xxx/xxx.git when initializing a new repo

fields.description: When I resolve an issue, I'm used to write "See a1b2c3" to link the issue to the related commit. The link created could have a the commit title as a tooltip (also practical while looking at the "Preview" tab while closing the issue).
fields.summary: Commit title tooltip in comments

fields.description:
I run pipeline for my project two months ago and everything OK but today it not working. I can't connect to MySQL service (through code). I didn't change any code before.

Note: I try to use command netstat -nplt and see just only redis port is listening, no mysql port.

Please check this function, and if it not a bug, please tell me what can I do to fix the problem.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Pipeline MySQL service no longer work
